channel.title: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?
channel.description: I'm using C++ and I need a cross platform way to grab the contents of a web page. That's all I need to do. I just want it to read a webpage into a string. Does anyone know how to do this?

item.title: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:12, topic:204849”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=270381.msg2226619#msg2226619 date=1210901405]
i get my information from understanding the topic, but wikipedia will do
[/quote]

Wikipedia was banned from our school…[/quote]Great!

Read full topic

[/quote]preprocessor*

same thing[/quote]of course a microsoft fanboy would say that

item.title: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Use Libcurl. It’s a high level library, not a sockets library, which is good for you.

If you want a cross-platform sockets library nonetheless, you can use boost::asio.

Read full topic
item.source: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?

item.title: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

http://www.pcs.cnu.edu/~dgame/sockets/socketsC++/sockets.html
Looks like it might work, assuming sys/socket.h is cross platform…or is that a unix thing?

Read full topic
item.source: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?

item.source: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?

item.title: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:2, topic:204849”]use sockets and make a simple http implementation,
there is a similar structure for sockets between windows and *nix, except windows has the bollocks WSAStartup() stuff, and it uses closesocket() instead of close()

you can use compiler directives to seperate the platform specific stuff, like which header files to have[/quote]
This is exactly what I’m trying to avoid. Is there a library to do this?

Read full topic
item.source: C++ Cross Platform Way To Get Web Page?

item.description:
@yakman wrote:

use sockets and make a simple http implementation,
there is a similar structure for sockets between windows and *nix, except windows has the bollocks WSAStartup() stuff, and it uses closesocket() instead of close()

you can use compiler directives to seperate the platform specific stuff, like which header files to have
